result.execSummary:
The defendant James N Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders restitution of $2,800.00 payable first, to Longina H., joint and several with 14CF280 and 14CF282, by 7/6/2016, or civil judgment with tax intercept. Bail to be applied first, if applicable.

Pay all MANDATORY cost, fees and surcharges by 7/6/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. Court waived NON-MANDATORY cost, fees and surcharges due to financial instability. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Consecutive to: to any sentence. Huber for work, school and childcare. Court does not object to electronic monitoring. Failure to report will result in a straight time sentence.
As a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James N Perkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Check Packet

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 40 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 10 days served; Huber privileges for work, school and childcare. Court does not object to electronic monitoring. Report by 7/10/2015 by 4pm.  Failure to report will result in a straight time sentence.

Court orders defendant to pay all MANDATORY cost, fees and surcharges by 7/6/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.  Court waived NON-MANDATORY cost, fees and surcharges due to financial instability.

Court orders restitution of $2,800.00 payable first, to Longina H., joint and several with 14CF280 and 14CF282, by 7/6/2016, or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied first, if applicable.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court ordered case adjourned to allow the state to comply with victim notification.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

NO FILE IN COURT.
Defendant is not in full compliance with the agreement.  Defendant has missed appointments and tested positive for alcohol.  Defendant missed appointments due to employment and made the appointment up the following day.  Defendant submitted a restitution payment.  Defendant is requesting an extension due to client going thru family issues.  State moves for revocation of the agreement.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
from WCS Milwaukee County Day Reporting Center, received and filed. lms

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. NO FILE IN COURT. Discussions of WCS report placed on the record. Defense advised she has been in contact with defendant. Court advised if defendant not back in compliance by next week, a warrant will be issued. Case remains set for Review Hearing on 5/29/2015.
from Milwaukee County Day Reporting Center , received and filed. lms

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

Defendant is somewhat in compliance. Defendant is not consistent with attendance at WCS. Defendant is employed and is enrolled at MATC. Defendant is paying toward restitution.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Per the Court, case can be set on a Thursday or Friday. Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant missed appointment at Day Reporting Center due to family emergency.  Defendant does have a make-up appointment scheduled.  Review hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is working full time and having scheduling issues with Fokus Family due to work hours. Defendant has submitted a payment for restitution. State is willing to allow the defendant to continue and not revoke at this time.  Review hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with student Intern Gabriela Leija under the supervision of attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is employed and submitted a restitution payment.  Defendant needs to comply with Fokus Family.  Review hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is not attending appointments and continues to test positive.  Defendant has completed 20 hours of community service and submitted a restitution payment.  Review hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Dawn Rablin for attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defndant has begun treatment.  Defendant is testing positive.  Defendant has completed 16 hours of community service.  Defendant needs to pay restitution.

  Review hearing scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant needs to complete community service.  Documentation of clean UAs is needed.  Review hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 21.
Filed,  signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement(DPA).  The Court reviewed the DPA with the defendant.  Terms and conditions of DPA placed on the record.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.
The parties stipulate to the criminal complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction for a period of SIX months.
The Court approved the DPA and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned to 8-11-2014 at 1:30pm at 8:15a.m. for review hearing in Branch 6.
  Review hearing scheduled for 08-11-2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint REJECTION Notice, received and filed.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with Attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared telephonically for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court to address discharge from JusticePoint supervision.  Discharge Report dated 4-28-14 reviewed with the parties.  Bail argument of the parties heard; state requests increase in cash bail.  The Court ordered cash bail to remain the same; defendant reordered to JusticePoint with same conditions as previously ordered.  The Court orders defendant to be drug tested forthwith.  Case remains set for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on 5-14-14 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.  Filed, Pretrial Release Conditions Order.
Voice message left for Attorney Megan Morrisey regarding discharge of defendant and the need for bail hearing./dds
JusticePoint DISCHARGE Report, received and filed.
VIOLATION Report (missed office contact), received and filed.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with Attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  JusticePoint report reviewed with the parties.  Defendant admonished by the court.  No action requested from the state at this time.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report, received and filed.
VIOLATION Report (missed telephone contact), received and filed.

Status conference held between all counsel.  Parties still engaged in negotiations.  State request for additional time for investigation granted.  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with Attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons for Attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Benjamin A Wesson for Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE.  Matter before the Court to address JusticePoint Violation.  Report reviewed with the parties.  Bail argument of the parties heard.  On motion of the state, the Court sets cash bail.  Case remains set for Status Conference on 3-06-14 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.
Original Transcript (15 pages) commencing on 01-31-2014  PRELIMINARY HEARING / ARRAIGNMENT received and filed.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with Attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Megan Carmody for Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court for Scheduling Conference.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report, received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with co-actors Antonio Perkins, Joshua Ritchie and victim Logino H.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for Jesica Ballenger for the State of Wisconsin.
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Bradley Blum.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-07-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant James N Perkins in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant James N Perkins in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
